alert.note: Alert for Knox; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 6:04PM EST until January 13 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following areas, in south central Kentucky, Laurel, McCreary, Pulaski, Wayne and Whitley. In southeast Kentucky, Clay and Knox. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas is ongoing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 600 PM EST, Excessive runoff from 1 to 2 inches of rainfall that fell earlier continues to cause minor flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monticello, Williamsburg, Barbourville, Manchester, Whitley City, Cumberland Falls S.P., Honeybee, Krupp, Duckrun, Youngs Creek, Beulah Heights, Bark Camp, Huxley, Bounty, Redbird, Clio, Parkers Lake, Deering, Grove and Wiborg.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
